SEARCH
Module simulation.animal_simulation
Package simulation.animal_simulation.map

Class Map

java.lang.Object
simulation.animal_simulation.map.Map
public class Map extends Object
The Map class represents the simulation environment where the animals live and interact. It contains all the animals and shelters in the simulation. The map is a grid of Ground objects, each of which can contain grass, thick vegetation, or a shelter. The map also keeps track of the animals in the simulation, including rabbits and foxes. The Map class is responsible for initializing the map and running the simulation steps. During each simulation step, the grass on the map regrows and each animal takes its turn.

  • Field Details

    • rootGround

      @NotNull public final @NotNull Ground rootGround
      The root ground of the map. It is the first ground in the first row of the map. It has id 1.

    • Map

      public Map(int size, int grassAmount, int thickVegetationAmount, List<Shelter> rabbitShelters, List<Shelter> foxShelters, LoggerController loggerController) throws IllegalAccessException
      Creates a map with the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      size - Size of the map.
      grassAmount - Amount of grass on the map.
      thickVegetationAmount - Amount of thick vegetation on the map.
      rabbitShelters - List of rabbit shelters.
      foxShelters - List of fox shelters.
      loggerController - The logger controller.

  • Method Details

    • hasAliveAnimals

      public boolean hasAliveAnimals()
      Returns true if there are alive animals on the map.

      Resets the quantity of grass.

    • doNextStep

      public void doNextStep()
      Does the next step of the simulation. It regrows the grass and then does the next step for each animal.
